div.div: A chance of showers, with thunderstorms also possible after 10am. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 62. Windy, with a north wind 13 to 18 mph increasing to 20 to 25 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.
A 10 percent chance of showers before 7pm. Mostly clear, with a low around 37. North wind 13 to 18 mph becoming west northwest 6 to 11 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 28 mph.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 67. Northwest wind 8 to 11 mph.

a.span:
Graduated Driver License Requirements
for Teen Drivers

strong.span:
ONLINE SUMMER DRIVERS’ EDUCATION 2020
USD 466 SCOTT COMMUNITY HIGH SCHOOL

Location: Classroom section online
Driving Section of behind the wheel, date and time to be announced

To: Parents and Students interested in Driver Education for summer of 2020
From: Allen Thornburg 620-214-2300 (cell) email (

Scott Community High School will be offering online driver education during
the month of June and July. In the few hours that are spent with your child,
it would be difficult to prepare them to be an expert driver. However, with your
supplemental supervision, we hope to develop the attitudes and skills that are
essential to safe driving. Limited enrollment is available, so please make sure students are pre enrolled.
USD 466 feels this is a vital part of a student’s education and that students will
benefit from this program. Enrollment fees of $220 per student includes all
materials necessary for completion of course are due the last week of May.
(Internet access is required)

Online application forms available to fill out and send, located on the top left
corner of this article. Email

forms to athornburg@usd466.org or
VIA mail by printing the application form.
Payment (check or card) will be made to SCHS and dropped off to the
high school office the week of May (5/18-22)
Attention Allen Thornburg 712 Main St. Scott City, KS 67871.

to ensure your placement in the class, please pre-enroll. If your teen has
any medical, physical, learning, or disability condition that SCHS needs to
be aware of, please attach a separate letter with the information
and include the Medical form also found on this page.

Each student must meet to qualify for completion of the SCHS Drivers Education Program.
1) Each student must be 14 years old at the beginning of class, and have passed the 8th grade.
2) Each student must attend 30 hours of classroom instructional time and
pass each section test with 80% or higher.
3) Each student will experience least 4 hours of “behind the wheel” instruction
during class time to encourage the student to master driving objectives
(time to be announced)
4) Each student must be in good standing with his or her school.

br.span: Cost of Drivers Education Class is $220 per student

Student must pass a Drivers Education Course to be eligible to apply for a
restricted

strong.span: license at age 15 if not qualifying for a farm permit.

br.span:
MANDATORY time on task to meet state required CLASS seat REQUIREMENTS)
Final must be taken onsite.

span.strong:
Students will sign up for at least four driving times, June 15-19
Need to attend only during their assigned driving time. June 22-26
(Sign up will time for each student to be announced)

h3.a: Information Regarding Free Meals for Scott City Children

p.strong:
NEW SCHEDULE FOR MEAL PICK UP AND DELIVERIES
BEGINNING APRIL 6TH—EVERYONE WILL BE GIVEN MEALS FOR TWO DAYS AND WE WILL BE OPEN & DELIVERING ON THE FOLLOWING DAYS—PLEASE CHECK YOUR BAGS FOR HOT ITEM MONDAYS/TUESDAYS

span.span:
MONDAY, APRIL 6---YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR MONDAY & TUESDAY
WEDNESDAY APRIL 8—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR WEDNESDAY & THURSDAY
FRIDAY APRIL 10—NO MEALS DUE TO EASTER BREAK
MONDAY APRIL 13—NO MEALS DUE TO EASTER BREAK
TUESDAY, APRIL 14—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR TUESDAY & WEDNESDAY
THURSDAY, APRIL 16—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY
BEGINNING APRIL 20—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS AS FOLLOWS:
MONDAYS—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY
WEDNESDAYS—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY
FRIDAYS—YOU WILL RECEIVE MEALS FOR FRIDAY
Thank you so much and stay safe!

strong.br:
Shallow Water--gas pumps,
Pence Church parking lot,
Modoc Elevator parking lot and
Grigston Elevator parking lot.
Pick up times will be 11:30-11:50 for all but Grigston and that pick up time will be 12:10-12:30 Monday-Through Friday (no meals April 10 & 13). If you are currently receiving meals to your home in the country and do not wish to meet at one of these locations, please let me know so that we can remove your meals from our list. We apologize for the inconvenience. If you will be needing meals and are not yet receiving them, I will need an email requesting drop, which site, how many kids, ages and whether or not they have an allergy. The changes will begin Monday, March 30.

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.div: The Mission of Scott County USD 466, a community requiring the high standards of a world class education in an enriched, safe environment, is to prepare all students to become productive members of a global society through state of the art technology and collaboration among all members of our community.
